page.title: 19Trade
page.content: There are two shops in the vilage,one a combined grocers and post office,the other an antique shop.The former keeps a small stock of all the necessary grocery items which are mostly purchased from Carlisle by the shop keeper.The postman brings newspapers and comics which have been previously ordered, he picks these up in Penrith after they have come from Carlisle by train.The post office carries the usual stock of stamps and cards and is responsible for Family Allowance and old Age pension payments The Antique shop was opened in 1970 and is stocked from local salerooms mainly small items.Trade is largely with other dealers and through the Antique Fairs in Cumbria.There is a small tourist trade and the shop is advertised in both trade magazines and tourist guides.
